caption:
This photograph depicts a bustling beach scene. The foreground features a sunlit beach crowded with people engaged in various activities typical for a beach setting. Many individuals are swimming in the ocean, while others are standing or walking along the waterâ€™s edge. Some are carrying surfboards, indicating they might be surfers heading into or coming out of the water. The beach is lined with numerous visitors lounging, sunbathing, and playing.

Beyond the sandy beach area, there is a row of parked vehicles, including multiple cars and campers, suggesting that many visitors have traveled to the beach for recreational purposes, possibly for a day trip or longer stay.

The background is dominated by a large, multi-story building complex presumably a beachfront condominium or hotel, which aligns along the upper beach ridge, indicating the developed nature of this seaside area. This structure has multiple balconies, all facing towards the sea, offering views of the ocean. Additionally, the cliffside behind the building adds a natural, rugged edge to the landscape.

The entire scene is set under a clear sky, which helps to highlight the vibrancy and busy atmosphere of a popular beach destination.
title: New townhouses overlook busy Doheny State Beach. The townhouses represent one of the few construction projects permitted within 1,000 yards of the shoreline after passage of the Coastal Zone Conservation Act in November, 1972. Several regulatory commissions are determining development and working on a final report that will be presented to the legislature by January, 1976, which will make recommendations for monitoring future coastal development.
